meanings.definition: A mass of undifferentiated cells capable of growth and differentiation into specialized tissues.
meanings.sent1: The blastemata in the embryo will develop into various organs and tissues.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the blastemata to understand how cells differentiate.
meanings.sent3: The blastemata decided to throw a party and invite all the different tissues to join!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a blastemata, growing and branching out into new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The potential of the blastemata to transform into different tissues is truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: She collected various specimens, including different blastemata from the lab.
meanings.sent2: The researchers examined the blastemata under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The blastemata were lined up neatly on the shelf, looking like a tiny army.
meanings.sent4: The blastemata scattered across the field, resembling a field of wildflowers.
meanings.sent5: The box contained a collection of blastemata, each with its own potential for growth.
